title: pow: ethash test mode is broken on master branch
body:
#### System information

OS & Version: OSX
Commit hash :  61ede86

#### Expected behaviour

`geth --dev --mine` should work.

#### Actual behaviour

It crashes.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

```go
func TestSearchInTestMode(t *testing.T) {
	block := types.NewBlockWithHeader(&types.Header{
		UncleHash:   types.EmptyUncleHash,
		Root:        types.EmptyRootHash,
		TxHash:      types.EmptyRootHash,
		ReceiptHash: types.EmptyRootHash,
		Difficulty:  big.NewInt(100),
	})
	NewTestEthash().Search(block, nil)
}
```

#### Backtrace

```text
--- FAIL: TestSearchInTestMode (0.00s)
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference [recovered]
	panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x41be9e2]

goroutine 34 [running]:
testing.tRunner.func1(0xc4200180d0)
	/usr/local/Cellar/go/1.8/libexec/src/testing/testing.go:622 +0x29d
panic(0x4215120, 0x43709a0)
	/usr/local/Cellar/go/1.8/libexec/src/runtime/panic.go:489 +0x2cf
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow.(*Ethash).dataset(0xc42008c080, 0x0, 0xc4200d6c40, 0xc42003dcd0, 0x4e1c6741c63dc403)
	/Users/fjl/develop/eth/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow/ethash.go:542 +0x192
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow.(*Ethash).Search(0xc42008c080, 0x4357e60, 0xc4200b0120, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
	/Users/fjl/develop/eth/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow/ethash.go:490 +0x12e
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow.TestSearchInTestMode(0xc4200180d0)
	/Users/fjl/develop/eth/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow/ethash_algo_test.go:41 +0x13f
testing.tRunner(0xc4200180d0, 0x426d598)
	/usr/local/Cellar/go/1.8/libexec/src/testing/testing.go:657 +0x96
created by testing.(*T).Run
	/usr/local/Cellar/go/1.8/libexec/src/testing/testing.go:697 +0x2ca
```

There might be more issues like this ([from gitter chat](https://gitter.im/ethereum/go-ethereum?at=58c9f23b05a31d5a4a609bd5)):

```text

    /home/immesys/w/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow/ethash_algo.go:350 +0x131 fp=0xc42b0f9a60 sp=0xc42b0f99e0

    /home/immesys/w/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pow/ethash.go:408 +0x1f8 fp=0xc42b0f9bd0 sp=0xc42b0f9a60
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core.ValidateHeader(0xc4201e1b00, 0x19b27a0, 0xc4201ee780, 0xc421506000, 0xc421503d40, 0x7f95001f0001, 0xc42b0f9e70, 0x931cbe)
    /home/immesys/w/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/block_validator.go:247 +0x935 fp=0xc42b0f9e08 sp=0xc42b0f9bd0
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core.(*BlockValidator).ValidateHeader(0xc4201108c0, 0xc421506000, 0xc421503d40, 0x62ca212b3a13cf01, 0xd787390755280b18, 0x0)
    /home/immesys/w/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/block_validator.go:201 +0x10d fp=0xc42b0f9e80 sp=0xc42b0f9e08
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core.(*HeaderChain).InsertHeaderChain.func1(0x4)
    /home/immesys/w/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/headerchain.go:284 +0x402 fp=0xc42b0f9fa0 sp=0xc42b0f9e80
github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core.(*HeaderChain).InsertHeaderChain.func2(0xc42e6b7a00, 0xc420318850, 0x4)
    /home/immesys/w/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/headerchain.go:299 +0x56 fp=0xc42b0f9fc8 sp=0xc42b0f9fa0
runtime.goexit()
    /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:2197 +0x1 fp=0xc42b0f9fd0 sp=0xc42b0f9fc8
created by github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core.(*HeaderChain).InsertHeaderChain
    /home/immesys/w/go/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/core/headerchain.go:300 +0x572
```
I have a hunch that this is related to the unsafe casts between `[]uint32` and `[]byte`.

So I can make the problem go away by:
- Put a global lock around the top half of Ethash.Verify() (ending just before it calls hashimotoLight), this may not be the minimal change
- Copy the cache uint32[] array inside the critical section, and pass the copy to hashimotoLight (after the lock is released)

If I do just the first step (still pass the original cache array to hashimotoLight) I get exactly the same crash. As soon as I swap the array to the copy, it has run fine overnight.
FYI I am on a private chain, and it crashes on a different block each time, so I don't think its the contents of what is being verified, just some race in the verification.

@karalabe I am not sure this problem is solved. I just got this again on 1.6.6:

